simple_nerf_profiled module¶

simple_nerf_profiled.py

This script implements a NeRF training loop with PyTorch’s built-in profiler to measure CPU and CUDA execution time, memory usage, and operator shapes.

Includes: - Positional encoding - NeRF MLP model - Volume rendering function - Profiling-enabled training loop

class simple_nerf_profiled.NeRF(pos_dim=10, dir_dim=4)[source]¶

Bases: Module

Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) network composed of two branches: - One for predicting density from position. - One for predicting RGB from direction and intermediate features.

Parameters:

  • pos_dim – Positional encoding frequency count for position.

  • dir_dim – Positional encoding frequency count for direction.

forward(x, d)[source]¶

Forward pass through NeRF model.

Parameters:

  • x – Input sample positions, shape (N, 3)

  • d – Input view directions, shape (N, 3)

Returns:

Tensor of shape (N, 4), [RGB (3), sigma (1)]

class simple_nerf_profiled.PositionalEncoding(num_freqs, include_input=True)[source]¶

Bases: Module

Positional encoding using sinusoidal basis functions.

Parameters:

  • num_freqs – Number of frequency bands.

  • include_input – If True, includes original input in encoded output.

forward(x)[source]¶

Applies sinusoidal encoding to input tensor.

Parameters:

x – Tensor of shape (…, input_dim)

Returns:

Encoded tensor of shape (…, encoded_dim)

simple_nerf_profiled.train_nerf()[source]¶

Trains a NeRF model while profiling with PyTorch’s profiler.

Logs: - CUDA and CPU time - Memory usage - Operator call stack

Prints the top 10 CUDA-time-consuming operations.

simple_nerf_profiled.volume_rendering(rgb_sigma, z_vals)[source]¶

Performs volume rendering using alpha compositing.

Parameters:

  • rgb_sigma – Tensor of shape (N, S, 4), where 4 = [R,G,B,sigma]

  • z_vals – Tensor of shape (N, S), depth values for each sample.

Returns:

Rendered RGB map, shape (N, 3)
